titleStmt.title: Reasons why the supreme authority of the three nations (for the time) is not in the Parliament, but in the new-established Councel of State, consisting of His Excellence the Lord General Cromvvel, and his honourable assessors. Written in answer to a letter sent from a gentleman in Scotland to a friend of his in London. To which is added the letter it self.
titleStmt.author: C. N.

publicationStmt.publisher: and are to be sold by Rich. Moone, at the seven Stars in Pauls Church-yard, neer the great north-door.,

notesStmt.note: A printing of and reply to a letter signed "C.N.".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: the seven Stars in Pauls Church-yard, neer the great north-door.
